titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mrs. Field's Literary Club records 1995.004
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-22T10:58-0500

physdesc.extent: in nine manuscript boxes and two half manuscript boxes.

did.abstract: This collection contains materials generated by Mrs. Field's Literary Club from the 1930s to the 1960s, including programs, letters, and minutes. The club was founded by Mrs. George W. Field in the latter half of the 19th century.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Mrs. Field's Literary Club (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Materials dating from the 1930s are currently open to researchers without restriction, but access restrictions apply for remaining materials in the collection. Materials dating from the 1940s will be open to researchers in 2015, materials dating from the 1950s will be open to researchers in 2025, and materials dating from the 1960s will be open to researchers in 2035.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Field's Literary Club, 1996.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Mrs. Field's Literary Club records, 1995.004, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
